extractions.description: This paper proposes a deep learning approach to address the limitations of conventional Ultrasound Localization Microscopy (ULM) in dealing with high concentrations of microbubbles, aiming to achieve a dense reconstruction of vascular networks. The researchers trained a three-dimensional convolutional neural network (3D CNN) based on a V-net architecture using a realistic mouse brain microvascular network. The model was validated both in silico and in vivo, demonstrating enhanced precision and resolution in microvessel imaging compared to conventional methods.
